description: Configures storage settings for IoT SiteWise.

parameters.name: storageType
parameters.description: The storage tier that you specified for your data. The storageType parameter can be one of the following values: SITEWISE_DEFAULT_STORAGE --- IoT SiteWise saves your data into the hot tier. The hot tier is a service-managed database. MULTI_LAYER_STORAGE --- IoT SiteWise saves your data in both the cold tier and the hot tier. The cold tier is a customer-managed Amazon S3 bucket.

parameters.name: multiLayerStorage
parameters.description: Identifies a storage destination. If you specified MULTI_LAYER_STORAGE for the storage type, you must specify a MultiLayerStorage object. Contains information about a customer managed Amazon S3 bucket. The ARN of the Amazon S3 object. For more information about how to find the ARN for an Amazon S3 object, see Amazon S3 resources in the Amazon Simple Storage Service User Guide. The ARN of the Identity and Access Management role that allows IoT SiteWise to send data to Amazon S3.

nested_params.name: customerManagedS3Storage
nested_params.description: Contains information about a customer managed Amazon S3 bucket.

nested_params.name: s3ResourceArn
nested_params.description: The ARN of the Amazon S3 object. For more information about how to find the ARN for an Amazon S3 object, see Amazon S3 resources in the Amazon Simple Storage Service User Guide.

nested_params.name: roleArn
nested_params.description: The ARN of the Identity and Access Management role that allows IoT SiteWise to send data to Amazon S3.

parameters.name: disassociatedDataStorage
parameters.description: Contains the storage configuration for time series (data streams) that aren't associated with asset properties. The disassociatedDataStorage can be one of the following values: ENABLED --- IoT SiteWise accepts time series that aren't associated with asset properties. DISABLED --- IoT SiteWise doesn't accept time series (data streams) that aren't associated with asset properties. For more information, see Data streams in the IoT SiteWise User Guide.

parameters.name: retentionPeriod
parameters.description: The number of days your data is kept in the hot tier. By default, your data is kept indefinitely in the hot tier. numberOfDays (integer) --- The number of days that your data is kept. unlimited (boolean) --- If true, your data is kept indefinitely.

nested_params.name: numberOfDays
nested_params.description: The number of days that your data is kept.

nested_params.name: unlimited
nested_params.description: If true, your data is kept indefinitely.

parameters.name: warmTierRetentionPeriod
parameters.description: Set this period to specify how long your data is stored in the warm tier before it is deleted. You can set this only if cold tier is enabled. numberOfDays (integer) --- The number of days the data is stored in the warm tier. unlimited (boolean) --- If set to true, the data is stored indefinitely in the warm tier.

nested_params.name: numberOfDays
nested_params.description: The number of days the data is stored in the warm tier.

nested_params.name: unlimited
nested_params.description: If set to true, the data is stored indefinitely in the warm tier.

nested_items.name: storageType
nested_items.description: The storage tier that you specified for your data. The storageType parameter can be one of the following values:
SITEWISE_DEFAULT_STORAGE --- IoT SiteWise saves your data into the hot tier. The hot tier is a service-managed database.
MULTI_LAYER_STORAGE --- IoT SiteWise saves your data in both the cold tier and the hot tier. The cold tier is a customer-managed Amazon S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: multiLayerStorage
nested_items.description: Contains information about the storage destination.

nested_items.name: customerManagedS3Storage
nested_items.description: Contains information about a customer managed Amazon S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: s3ResourceArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the Amazon S3 object. For more information about how to find the ARN for an Amazon S3 object, see Amazon S3 resources in the Amazon Simple Storage Service User Guide.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the Identity and Access Management role that allows IoT SiteWise to send data to Amazon S3.

nested_items.name: disassociatedDataStorage
nested_items.description: Contains the storage configuration for time series (data streams) that aren't associated with asset properties. The disassociatedDataStorage can be one of the following values:
ENABLED --- IoT SiteWise accepts time series that aren't associated with asset properties.

nested_items.name: retentionPeriod
nested_items.description: The number of days your data is kept in the hot tier. By default, your data is kept indefinitely in the hot tier.

nested_items.name: numberOfDays
nested_items.description: The number of days that your data is kept.

nested_items.name: unlimited
nested_items.description: If true, your data is kept indefinitely.

nested_items.name: configurationStatus
nested_items.description: Contains current status information for the configuration.

nested_items.name: state
nested_items.description: The current state of the configuration.

nested_items.name: code
nested_items.description: The error code.

nested_items.name: message
nested_items.description: The error message.

nested_items.name: warmTier
nested_items.description: A service managed storage tier optimized for analytical queries. It stores periodically uploaded, buffered and historical data ingested with the CreaeBulkImportJob API.

nested_items.name: warmTierRetentionPeriod
nested_items.description: Set this period to specify how long your data is stored in the warm tier before it is deleted. You can set this only if cold tier is enabled.

nested_items.name: numberOfDays
nested_items.description: The number of days the data is stored in the warm tier.

nested_items.name: unlimited
nested_items.description: If set to true, the data is stored indefinitely in the warm tier.

nested_items.name: disallowIngestNullNaN
nested_items.description: Describes the configuration for ingesting NULL and NaN data. By default the feature is allowed. The feature is disallowed if the value is true.
